definition-item.definition-title: NON-POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT MACHINES OR ENGINES, e.g. STEAM TURBINES (machines or engines for liquids F03; non-positive displacement pumps F04D)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Non-positive-displacement engines for elastic fluids, e.g. steam turbines,
Non-positive-displacement engines for liquids and elastic fluids,
Non-positive-displacement machines for Iiquids and elastic fluids.

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
In this subclass the indexing scheme F05D is used as follows:
F05D2200/00: mathematical features
F05D2210/00: working fluid
F05D2220/00: application
F05D2230/00: manufacture
F05D2240/00:components
F05D2250/00: geometry
F05D2260/00: function
F05D2270/00: control
F05D2300/00: materials

definition-item.definition-title: Non-positive-displacement machines or engines, e.g. steam turbines (wit working-fluid flows in opposite axial directions for balancing axial thrust F01D3/02; with other than pure rotation F01D23/00; turbines characterised by their use in special steam systems, cycles, or processes, regulating devices therefor F01K)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Non-positive-displacement machines or engines, e.g. steam turbines: i.e. machine or engine that uses an impeller or propeller and through which fluid is moved

Machines or engines with working-fluid flows in opposite axial directions for balancing axial thrust F01D3/02, with other than pure rotation F01D23/00, turbines characterised by their use in special steam systems, cycles, or processes, regulating devices therefor F01K
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or engines with working-fluid flows in opposite axial directions for balancing axial thrust
Machines or engines with other than pure rotation
Turbines characterised by their use in special steam systems, cycles, or processes, regulating devices therefor

definition-item.definition-title: with stationary working-fluid guiding means and bladed or like rotor, {e.g. multi-bladed impulse steam turbines} (F01D1/24 takes precedence; without stationary working-fluid guiding means F01D1/18)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Machines or engines without stationary working-fluid guiding means

section-body.paragraph-text: F01D1/24 takes precedence

definition-item.definition-title: with pressure velocity transformation exclusively in rotor, e.g. the rotor rotating under the influence of jets issuing from the rotor, {e.g. Heron turbines (the working fluid being a combustion products F02C3/165; jet propulsion plants per se F02K)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Aspects of working fluid being guided through a rotor construction such that the action of the expelled working fluid jet creates a reaction on the rotor, i.e. a turning motion is induced upon the rotor
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: The working fluid being a combustion product

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D1/32
taken from DE102009005872

definition-item.definition-title: using fluid friction

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Aspects of extracting power from working fluid by making use of the viscous forces within the fluid, usually by the provision of a stack of closely arranged plates through which the working fluid is forced, such as e.g. a Tesla turbine
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D1/36
taken from WO2009150427

definition-item.definition-title: of the screw type

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D1/38
taken from FR937311

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by having one fluid flow in one axial direction and another fluid flow in the opposite direction

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D3/02
taken from FR937311

definition-item.definition-title: axial thrust being compensated by thrust-balancing dummy piston or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D3/04
taken from US2326112

definition-item.definition-title: Blades; Blade-carrying members (nozzle boxes F01D9/02); Heating, heat-insulating, cooling or antivibration means on the blades or the members {(special arrangements in rotors dealing with breaking off of part thereof F01D21/045)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements in rotors dealing with breaking off of part thereof

definition-item.definition-title: {Repairing methods or devices}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Restoring or reconditioning fractured or cracked metal turbine components, e.g. blades or rotors
Maintenance management and planing of maintenance routines

definition-item.definition-title: {for flow machines or engines with only one axial stage (for more than one stage F01D5/06)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/021
taken from GB944166

definition-item.definition-title: {with concentric rows of axial blades}

taken from US6578351

definition-item.definition-title: {of the screw type}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/023
taken from US4500254

definition-item.definition-title: {Fixing blade carrying members on shafts (attachment of a member on a shaft in general F16D1/06; for non-positive displacement pumps F04D29/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Attachment of a member on a shaft in general

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/025
taken from US2010297468

definition-item.definition-title: {Shaft to shaft connections}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/026
taken from US2010226786

definition-item.definition-title: {the rotor disc being formed of sheet laminae (rotor blade aggregates of unitary construction F01D5/34)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Rotor discs which are made by stacking several sheets of metallic or composite plate like elements together and attaching them to each other, e.g. by gluing or clamping in order to form a single rotor disk or a stacked rotor assembly.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Rotor blade aggregates of unitary construction such as bladed disks (BLISKS) or other integrally manufactured rotor and disc arrangements, e.g. machined from a billet, manufactured by composite materials or manufactured individually and finally joined to a non separable unit, e.g. by friction welding

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/028
taken from GB630395

definition-item.definition-title: Annular blade-carrying members having blades on the inner periphery of the annulus and extending inwardly radially, i.e. inverted rotors

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/03
taken from US2006016172

definition-item.definition-title: for radial-flow machines or engines

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/04
taken from JP59113202

definition-item.definition-title: {of the Ljungström type}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Ljungström type machines in which the working fluid usually flows radially outwardly between two counter rotating bladed plates or more generally speaking turbines in which the fluid is expanded in a radial direction passing through consecutive turbine stages, wherein the turbine blades are mounted in circular alternating rows on plate like structures
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/041
taken from EP811752

definition-item.definition-title: {the wheel comprising two adjacent bladed wheel portions, e.g. with interengaging blades for damping vibrations}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/045
taken from US4183719

definition-item.definition-title: for counteracting blade vibration

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
All aspects of blade vibration and countermeasures thereof if related to the blade itself and its construction
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/16
taken from US6033186

definition-item.definition-title: {Film cooling (F01D5/187 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
All aspects of film cooled blades, arrangement and shape of film cooling holes
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/186
taken from EP2267276
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: expression used in order to describe the cooling technology used in order to cool a blade with an external layer of coolant

definition-item.definition-title: {Convection cooling}

taken from EP1367222

definition-item.definition-title: Blade-to-blade connections, {e.g. for damping vibrations}

taken from US6402474

taken from JP59108804

taken from EP1980715

definition-item.definition-title: Selecting particular materials; {Particular measures relating thereto;} Measures against erosion or corrosion

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Selecting composite materials, e.g. blades with reinforcing filaments}

section-body.paragraph-text: Indexing Code-codes for fibers, materials, resin etc. in F05D2300/00

definition-item.definition-title: {Protective coatings for blades}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Composition of the coating(s) is covered by C23C28/00

definition-item.definition-title: {of axial insertion type}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/3007
taken from EP2233696

definition-item.definition-title: {with side plates}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D5/3015
taken from EP1895103

definition-item.definition-title: Rotors with blades adjustable in operation; Control thereof (for reversing F01D1/30)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Rotors with blades adjustable in operation, e.g. unshrouded fans with a single rotor or two counter-rotating rotors
taken from US2006188375
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: Stators

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Stators, i.e. stationary fluid guiding arrangements such as nozzles etc
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Nozzle boxes}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Nozzle boxes, i.e. usually a bladed section of a guiding apparatus with inner and outer shrouds segments that when assembled with several other nozzle boxes results in a stator structure. Two or four nozzle boxes form a complete circular fluid supply assembly
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D9/047
taken from EP1703083

definition-item.definition-title: {for radial admission}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Nozzles or nozzles boxes forming a ring or a sector and in which working fluid is supplied radially onto a turbine stage or a turbine wheel
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D9/048
taken from US200805689

definition-item.definition-title: Fluid supply conduits to nozzles or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The fluid conduits themselves, i.e. anything that supplies fluid into the casing of the turbine or ducts fluid around the casing, e.g. from a bleed valve to the user or a hot section of the turbine
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D9/06
taken from EP967376

definition-item.definition-title: {Fluid supply or removal conduits traversing the working fluid flow, e.g. for lubrication-, cooling-, or sealing fluids (see also F01D25/16, F01D25/24 and F01D25/26)}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D9/065
taken from US2010275572

definition-item.definition-title: Preventing or minimising internal leakage of working-fluid, e.g. between stages (sealings in general F16J {; sealing arrangements for transition ducts of combustor cans F01D9/023})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sealing issues related to centrifugal compressors

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Sealing arrangements for transition ducts of combustor cans

taken from US3146938

taken from GB866636

definition-item.definition-title: by selectively cooling-heating stator or rotor components

taken from EP1555394

definition-item.definition-title: Combinations of two or more machines or engines (F01D15/00 takes precedence; combinations of two or more pumps F04; fluid gearing F16H)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adaptations of machines or engines for special use; Combinations of engines with devices driven thereby

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Combinations of two or more pumps

definition-item.definition-title: {with at least two independent shafts, i.e. cross-compound}

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D13/003
taken from JP359003104

definition-item.definition-title: {one being a reverse turbine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Machines or engines containing a separate turbine for reverse operation
taken from US4245467

definition-item.definition-title: Working-fluid interconnection of machines or engines

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D13/02
taken from US4986732

definition-item.definition-title: Adaptations of machines or engines for special use; Combinations of engines with devices driven thereby

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Adaptation off machines or engines for special use, combinations of engines with devices driven thereby: gas turbines in combination with pumps, electrical generators, turbines specifically adapted for driving vehicles, air turbines used in compressed air driven power tools or dentistry applications
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Adaptations for driving, or combinations with, electric generators

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Features relating to the electrical generator

definition-item.definition-title: Regulating or controlling by varying flow (for reversing F01D1/30; by varying rotor-blade position F01D7/00; specially for starting F01D19/00; shutting-down F01D21/00; regulating or controlling in general G05 {; specially adapted for hand-held tools or the like F01D15/06})

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Regulating or controlling by varying flow for reversing

definition-item.definition-title: responsive to speed

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: responsive to condition of working-fluid, e.g. pressure

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {for radial flow, i.e. the vanes turning around axes which are essentially parallel to the rotor centre line (F01D17/167 takes precedence)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Vanes assemblies usually activated by a unison ring or the like in which the vanes are turning uniformly around an axis that is parallel to the rotor main axis, e.g. like in a conventional automotive turbocharger assembly
If specific for turbochargers classify also in F05D2220/40 as additional information or F02C6/12 as invention information
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D17/165
taken from US2003014972

definition-item.definition-title: {of vanes moving in translation}

section-body.paragraph-text: If specific for turbochargers classify also in F05D2220/40 as additional information or F02C6/12 as invention information

definition-item.definition-title: Starting of machines or engines; Regulating, controlling, or safety means in connection therewith (warming-up before starting F01D25/10; turning or inching gear F01D25/34)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Control of a generator (circuit) during starting/stopping of driving means

definition-item.definition-title: Shutting-down of machines or engines, e.g. in emergency; Regulating, controlling, or safety means not otherwise provided for

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Shutting-down of machines or engines, e.g. in emergency; regulating, controlling, or safety means not otherwise provided for, e.g. shutting down operations or methods should be classified in here if none of the sub groups apply

definition-item.definition-title: {Arrangements for testing or measuring (for measuring vibrations G01H)}
Trip gear

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Trip mechanisms for trip valves
taken from US4379544

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangement of bearings; Supporting or mounting bearings in casings (bearings per se F16C)

definition-item.definition-title: Lubricating arrangements (of machines or engines in general F01M)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Aspects related to lubrication of the engine such as lubrication circuits, lubricant supply, scavenging and the like, covers also features relating to turbochargers and lubrication thereof
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Lubricating arrangements of machines or engines in general

section-body.paragraph-text: If specific for turbochargers classify also in F05D2220/40

definition-item.definition-title: Casings (modified for heating or cooling F01D25/14); Casing parts, e.g. diaphragms, casing fastenings (casings for rotary machines or engines in general F16M {; special arrangements in stators dealing with breaking-off of part of rotor F01D21/045})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Casings for turbomachinery and also features relating to turbocharger casings.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Special arrangements in stators dealing with breaking-off of part of rotor
Casings modified for heating or cooling
Casings for rotary machines or engines in general

section-body.paragraph-text: If specific for turbochargers classify also in F05D2220/40

definition-item.definition-title: {Temporary support structures, e.g. for testing, assembling, installing, repairing; Assembly methods using such structures}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices holding or positioning work or tools

taken from GB1211313

definition-item.definition-title: Exhaust heads, chambers, or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Silencing or noise abatement in jet pipes or walls

section-body.paragraph-text: Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D25/30
taken from EP1262666 and US3945760

list-item.paragraph-text: Classify in F05D2260/96 in case of noise suppression.

definition-item.definition-title: {with fluid, e.g. liquid injection}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Exhaust heads or chambers or diffusers comprising an additional injection of fluid such as air or liquids for any desired purpose such as cooling, cleaning of exhaust, deswirling etc.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in F01D25/305
taken from US3885822

definition-item.definition-title: Turning or inching gear

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Auxiliary equipment for rotating the rotor of a gas or steam turbine at low rpm, e.g. for inspection purposes or prevention of sagging and the like
taken from US4430575
